_symbol_format: .TICKER YYMMDD P/C STRIKE  (positive qty = buy, negative = sell)
_source: Ravish passive strategies playbook - Hybrid Collar (4-leg)
notes: NVDA hybrid LEAPS collar: long 100 shares + buy 170P + sell call + sell deep OTM 120P. 4th leg (sold put) funds moving the call strike further out, maximizing upside cap.
rationale: Enhancement of zero-cost collar. Additional sold deep OTM put generates credit to push the sold call further right (higher strike), increasing upside range. Trade-off: you accept risk below the deep OTM put strike. For individual top stocks only.

entry_conditions.iv_environment: Higher IV preferred — deep OTM put generates more credit. IV rank >25 ideal.

structure.leg3: Sell covered call (strike TBD — as far OTM as possible)
structure.leg4: Sell deep OTM put (120P — 37% below). Credit from this leg moves call strike higher.

deep_otm_put_rules.note: This is your catastrophic risk floor. Stock would need to drop 37% for this put to be ITM. Acceptable for quality stocks.
deep_otm_put_rules.strike_selection: Choose a price where you'd be willing to buy at anyway (below long-term support zone)

call_strike_optimization.goal: Use credit from deep OTM put to move call strike further right
call_strike_optimization.method: Net collar cost should be zero or small credit. Deep put credit expands the range.
call_strike_optimization.example: Without 4th leg: call at 210. With deep 120P: call at 225. More upside room.

stock_criteria.note: Collars are risk-adjusted strategies. Profits capped, losses capped. For individual top stocks only.

entry_conditions.notes: Hybrid LEAPS Collar: buy shares + buy put + sell call + sell deep OTM put. The 4th leg (deep put) generates credit to push call strike further out, expanding profit range. Risk: if stock crashes 37%+, deep put is breached. Acceptable for quality stocks with strong long-term fundamentals.

pnl_drivers.max_profit: Call strike - stock cost. Higher than standard collar because deep put credit funds a higher call strike. Example: (225-191) x 100 = $3,400.
pnl_drivers.max_loss: Two zones: (1) Stock between deep put and protective put: loss = stock cost - protective put strike = (191-170) x 100 = $2,100. (2) Below deep put (120): loss increases — (191-170) x 100 + (120-stock) x 100.
pnl_drivers.primary_driver: Stock appreciation within wider collar range (170 to 225)
pnl_drivers.secondary_driver: Deep OTM put theta — decays quickly since it's far OTM
pnl_drivers.tertiary_driver: All premiums offset — near zero cost entry

greeks_profile.theta: slightly positive — sold call + sold deep put theta exceeds bought put theta
greeks_profile.vega: slightly negative — two sold options vs one bought
greeks_profile.delta: positive ~50 — stock 100, bought put -25, sold call -30, sold deep put +5
greeks_profile.gamma: mixed — bought put positive, both sold options negative

exit_rules.profit_target: Stock at or above call strike. Close or let expire.
exit_rules.if_deep_put_threatened: If stock drops 25%+, close the deep put or roll down. Reassess thesis.
exit_rules.management: Quarterly check. Minimal management needed. Set and forget.
exit_rules.at_expiry: If stock in range: all options expire, keep shares. If above call: called away at profit. If below put: put protects.

pnl_drivers.ideal_scenario: NVDA rises to 225 over 12 months. Called away at 225 for $3,400 profit on ~$19,100 investment = 18% return. Zero cost collar. Deep put was never threatened.
